title: BeMap: Balanced Message Passing for Fair Graph Neural Network. (arXiv:2306.04107v1 [cs.LG])
abstract: Graph Neural Network (GNN) has shown strong empirical performance in many downstream tasks by iteratively aggregating information from the local neighborhood of each node, i.e., message passing. However, concrete evidence has revealed that a graph neural network could be biased against certain demographic groups, which calls for the consideration of algorithmic fairness. Despite the increasing efforts in ensuring algorithmic fairness on graph neural networks, they often do not explicitly consider the induced bias caused by message passing in GNN during training. In this paper, we first investigate the problem of bias amplification in message passing. We empirically and theoretically demonstrate that message passing could amplify the bias when the 1-hop neighbors from different demographic groups are unbalanced. Guided by such analyses, we propose BeMap, a fair message passing method, that leverages a balance-aware sampling strategy to balance the number of the 1-hop neighbors of each n

translated_title: BeMap：平衡的消息传递方法用于公平的图神经网络。
translated_abstract: 图神经网络（GNN）通过迭代地聚合每个节点的局部邻域信息来表现出强大的实证性能，即消息传递。然而，具体证据显示，图神经网络可能对某些人口群体存在偏见，这要求考虑算法的公正性。尽管越来越多的努力在保证图神经网络的算法公平性，但在训练期间往往并不明确考虑消息传递在GNN中引起的偏差。本文首先研究了消息传递中的偏差放大问题。我们通过经验证据和理论证明，当来自不同人口群体的1-hop邻居不平衡时，消息传递可能会放大偏差。在这些分析的指导下，我们提出了BeMap，一种公平的消息传递方法，利用平衡感知的采样策略来平衡每个节点的1-hop邻居的数量。
tldr: 本文提出了一种公平的消息传递方法，称为BeMap，旨在解决消息传递中的偏差放大问题，通过平衡感知的采样策略来平衡不同人口群体的1-hop邻居的数量。
en_tdlr: This paper proposes a fair message passing method, called BeMap, to address the problem of bias amplification in message passing, by leveraging a balance-aware sampling strategy to balance the number of 1-hop neighbors among different demographic groups.
